page.title: 02GLOSSOPDALE 1985 (2)
page.content: Standing on the edge of the{Peak {District National Park}Glossop is increasingly a centre for{tourism.}The town possesses two fine public parks - {Howard Park }and{Manor Park}- the latter being the grounds of the 19th. century Hall of the Howard family, Lords of the Manor until 1926. A carnival is held in July and a{ {Victorian Weekend }in September when the town's shop windows are dressed appropriate to the period, street organs and shoeshine boys appear on the streets and and many dress in costumes from that era. The public Bank Holidays are also occasions for large {street markets.}Only one { {textile manufacturer}remains in the area but many people are employed in{garment making.}There is also{light {engineering,}and the making of{rubber, specialist{foams,}and {metal alloys.
